conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and geometry involved.
Light source is initially positioned above objects, casting shadows A, B, and C.
Shadows are formed due to obstruction of light by objects.
When light source moves to the right, angle of incidence changes.
Shadows will shift to the left due to change in light direction.
Shadow A will move to the left and shape may change slightly.
Shadow B will move to the left and spiral pattern may elongate or compress.
Shadow C will move to the left and elongation may increase or decrease.
Size of shadows can change based on angle of light.
Shadow A may become longer if light is at a lower angle.
Shadow B may become more elongated if light is at a lower angle.
Shadow C may become longer if light is at a lower angle.
Conclusion: Shadows A, B, and C shift left and may change size depending on light angle.
